snippet: The Georgia State Board of Pardons and Paroles and a federal judge denied Marcus Wellons’s clemency request Monday afternoon. He is scheduled to be executed Tuesday at 7 p.m.
abstract: Georgia State Board of Pardons and Paroles and Federal Judge Timothy C Batten Sr deny clemency request for Marcus Wellons, Georgia inmate who was sentenced to death in the 1989 rape and murder of a 15-year-old girl; absent a court order issuing a reprieve, Wellons will be the first person executed in the United States since the botched lethal injection in Oklahoma of Clayton D Lockett on April 29.
lead_paragraph: The Georgia State Board of Pardons and Paroles and a federal judge denied Marcus Wellons’s clemency request Monday afternoon. He is scheduled to be executed Tuesday at 7 p.m.

headline.main: U.S. Judge Denies Stay of Execution in Georgia
headline.print_headline: U.S. Judge Denies Stay of Execution in Georgia
